alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 18 at 10:23AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: .Flooding along the Beaver Creek near County Roads 24 and 74. Reported 12 to 18 inches of water over the roadway. Roadway is completely flooded. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following county, Sherman. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 921 AM MDT, Trained weather spotter reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Beaver Creek, North Fork Sappa Creek, Middle Fork Sappa Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Sherman County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
